data.content:
noun
plural -tions
[count] law :a formal statement that someone who has promised to tell the truth makes so that the statement can be used in court especially; :a formal statement that is made before a trial by a witness who will not be present at the trial
She gave a videotaped deposition about what she saw that night.
His attorneys took depositions from the witnesses.
[noncount] technical :the action of depositing something (such as sand, snow, or mud) on a surface or area especially over a period of time
the deposition of sand and gravel on the river bed
[count, noncount] formal :the act removing someone from a powerful position :the act of deposing someone
deposition of the king

Danh từ
sự phế truất (vua…), sự hạ bệ
sự cung khai; lời cung khai
